[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/pinkas/mod.rs] [Cryptographic] [Point validation] Are all deserialized G1Projective and G2Projective points validated to lie on the curve before use? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/pinkas/mod.rs] [Cryptographic] [Subgroup check] Do all group operations verify points are in the correct prime-order subgroup of BLS12-381? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/pinkas/mod.rs] [Cryptographic] [Pairing degeneracy] Can degenerate pairings (e.g., e(O, P) or e(P, O)) be exploited to bypass verification checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/pinkas/mod.rs] [Cryptographic] [Small order points] Can an attacker inject small-order points into public keys or signatures to manipulate VUF outputs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/pinkas/mod.rs] [Resource] [Vector allocation] Can attackers cause excessive memory allocation by providing large proof vectors or high weight values to exhaust validator memory? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/pinkas/mod.rs] [Resource] [Thread pool saturation] Can malicious proof structures cause thread_pool operations to create excessive threads and exhaust system resources? (Medium)
